Class SettingsManager

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.ui.SettingsManager
public final class SettingsManager extends Object
Manages persistent application settings. Handles loading and saving user preferences including ghost block, music, sound effects, and music track selection.
Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • isGhostBlockEnabled

      public static boolean isGhostBlockEnabled()
      Checks if the ghost block feature is enabled.
      Returns:
      true if ghost block is enabled, false otherwise

    • setGhostBlockEnabled

      public static void setGhostBlockEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets the ghost block enabled state and saves to persistent storage.
      Parameters:
      enabled - the new ghost block state

    • isMusicEnabled

      public static boolean isMusicEnabled()
      Checks if background music is enabled.
      Returns:
      true if music is enabled, false otherwise

    • setMusicEnabled

      public static void setMusicEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets the music enabled state and saves to persistent storage.
      Parameters:
      enabled - the new music state

    • isSoundEffectsEnabled

      public static boolean isSoundEffectsEnabled()
      Checks if sound effects are enabled.
      Returns:
      true if sound effects are enabled, false otherwise

    • setSoundEffectsEnabled

      public static void setSoundEffectsEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets the sound effects enabled state and saves to persistent storage.
      Parameters:
      enabled - the new sound effects state

    • getSelectedMusicTrack

      public static String getSelectedMusicTrack()
      Gets the currently selected music track.
      Returns:
      the name of the selected music track

    • setSelectedMusicTrack

      public static void setSelectedMusicTrack(String track)
      Sets the selected music track and saves to persistent storage.
      Parameters:
      track - the name of the music track to select

    • ensureDirectoryExists

      public static void ensureDirectoryExists()
      Ensures the directory for storing settings exists.
